Accessing-Object-Properties_key1: In two ways we can access properties of object i.e.,** dot notation (.)** and **bracket notation ([ ])**, similar to an array.
Accessing-Object-Properties_key2: Here is a sample of using dot notation (.) to read an object's property:
Accessing-Object-Properties_key4: vege`tab`les.veg1 would have the value of potato, vege`tab`les.veg2 would have the value of brinjal, vege`tab`les.veg3 would have the value of bottle gourd.
Accessing-Object-Properties_key5: The second way to access the properties of an object is bracket notation ([ ]). If the property of the object you are trying to access has a space in its name, you will need to use bracket notation.
Accessing-Object-Properties_key6: However, you can still use bracket notation on object properties has without spaces.

Accessing-Object-Properties_key9: myDetails["first name"] would be the `string` "kumar", myDetails["last name"] would be the `string` "vadthya", myDetails["middle name"] would be the `string` "nayak".
